data.title: Good food small restaurant
data.text: We had dinner recently and ordered Karahi chicken and behari kabab. It was very good but spicy. Also try sugarcane juice. Will recommend this place if you are in Dallas .👍

data.title: Went to eat at this place by mistake.....
data.text: During our stay in Dallas we were looking for a restaurant we searched online. However, as we noticed this restaurant we decided to stop by. WOW!!! Super delicious  Pakistani food. You must try the LAMB SHANK NIHARI. I was shocked how delicious and inexpensive it was.

data.title: Great Indian food!
data.text:
The food here is spectacularly good! I cannot get the depth of flavors out of my mind. I wish there was no such thing as getting full because I would sit there all day and just eat everything. 

I had the chicken karahi/korma and the wife had the beef karahi/korma and both were nothing short of stupendous. The meat was tender, fall apart at the touch. The flavors were deep and aromatic. The mild sauce had the right amount of kick and both were wonderfully spicy without being overly hot.

The naan bread was also excellent, not at all greasy. The accompanying rice was perfect. 

I also got an app of the samosas and they came with the best chick peas I ever ate. Soft, flavorful, just perfect. 

The prices are very reasonable. The ambience is on the modest side. The service was slow but friendly and helpful. 

We just found our new go-to Indian restaurant. Can't wait to return!

data.title: Great Lahori Food
data.text:
This is a hidden gem for desi food in DFW area. Hafeez Bhai is doing wonders with Chicken Tikka, Kabob, Baryani and my favourite, The Kheer.
I also recommend Palao, Murgh Cholay and Charga. Really enjoyed Gajjar Halwa too recently.
Miss Geneva serves the customers well and the place is mostly busy.
